Title: waterpoof!
Cons: for a 10 mega-pix camera... I dont know I guess I was expecting more... its also a little on the bulky / heavy side, but thats just because its made out of METAL... this thing should last a LONG time.
Pros: its water proof, what more do you want?! Right out of the box, and into the kitchen sink (first test) I can't wait until summer to take this thing wakeboarding (with a big yellow float tied to it)

Title: fantastic outdoors camera
Cons: Doesn't use a standard mini-USB cable, but a smaller connector, while this saves space it's annoying to have another cable to deal with. The Image Stabalizer option doesn't have the option to be always running or when the picture is taken unlike in my Canon SD-700is
Pros: Awesome Camera, it's waterproof, has good optical zoom.
Comments: It's great for the active outdoor person. You don't have to worry to much about dropping it on land or in water (assuming it's not going very deep)

Title: Great Camera
Cons: wish it floated lol, wouldnt want to drop it snorkeling or something, probably attach a boat key float or something to the wrist strap
Pros: Water proof to 30 feet, most are only 10 feet, that could break in a swimming pool, snorkeling would be dangerous. This camera give a lot of room for depth judgment. Focuses and takes pictures very fast. Small and compact very sturdy
Comments: Tested this in the pool the first day, it was awesome.

Cons: just a few little things that i wish were different: No flash for video camera mode, would be nice; have to take battery out of camera to charge; special USB cable to connect to computer.... my old Olympus was just a mini USB...
Pros: Awesome pictures under water... take any where and go, no worries at all. Friends are all jealous... camera takes great pictures...not professional, but for someone that just wants to take pictures, its great

Title: Nice Camera!
Cons: It is a little high on the price side. I love Olympus point and shoot cameras, I have three. However, the one thing I hate is that you do have to remove the battery to charge it.
Pros: It works! It was a little scary dunking my new camera in the pool. But it doe a great job of keeping out the water and it is shock proof. I would not normally mention ease of operation but my three year old actually uses this camera. Hard to find anything in this price range that is water proof. I thought the trade off for a water proof camera would be accepting a lower image quality. However, this camera takes a pretty good picture. If you have a pool or are going to the beach then this is a must have camera. You do not have to worry about sand, water, or dirt. If you own an Olympus already, you will know exactly how to use this camera. Underwater picture open up a whole new world.
Comments: Try tricking your friends and "accidentally" drop your new camera in the water and watch their reaction:)

Title: Sturdy little camera
Cons: XD cards dont have a very large capacity compared other formats, but it still will take over 400 pictures on one card.  And with the micro SD adapter you can get some larger capacities.
Pros: Great picture, almost as good as my Olympus E500 SLR.  It's as sturdy as advertised.  It has survived everything from being beat against rocks and submerged in rivers on hiking trips to being beaten with me in a mosh pit.
Comments: It's a great camera, well worth the money.  Nice when I dont want to carry around my big DSLR.

Title: Indestructible Camera (virtually)
Cons: I wish it used compact flash or SD cards.  Xd carsPicture quality is not as good as my Nikon D300, but it's a point and shoot.  It's a little small to hold, but perfect for my pocket.  There are some adjustment modes, but it lacks manual control over aperture and shutter speed.
Pros:
This camera has proven to be virtually indestructible.  I have a 5 year old and a 3 year old who both use it.  They have dropped it several times and it doesn't phase it.  We also took it to the pool and it shot flawless video and photos.  

Picture quality is great for a point and shoot.  Menus are fairly intuitive.
Comments: This camera has been so much fun, especially in the water.  I'm still nervous everytime I take it in, but it always works.  I love it and my kids love it and my wife loves it because it is virtually worry free.

Title: 1030 SW Needs better menus, standard memory and cables
Cons:
Menu system really lacks that of Canon and Nikon.
Non standard mini-usb plug
uses xdPicture card for storage and not SD
video feature mentioned above is only good for 7 seconds.
Pros:
Solid built camera
great features for taking in water and the elements
has a cool video setting that will record and buffer up to the PREVIOUS 2 seconds of footage BEFORE you press record
Comments: This is my first time to stray from Canon and i am now returning the camera and will just get a water proof housing for the camera I get in its place

Title: solid choice
Cons: the lcd can be hard to see when the ambient light is very bright, and even harder underwater.  the menu can be cumbersome to navigate through
Pros: a great camera that has many features that many compact digitals don't have with many capture modes in case you dont really know how to take good pictures of fireworks (like me.)  i was most interested in the waterproof aspect and im pleased to say that the only limiting factor in taking pictures underwater is the clarity of the water.  in the clean pool i work at ive gotten great action shots of dives and flips, as well as portraits and such.  the manometer (pressure guage) is very cool and the camera remembers the depth aany picture was taken at.
Comments: my brother is a semi professional photographer and he says that there are many options that he didn't expect on a point and shoot compact camera.

Title: Great Little Rugged/Waterproof Go-Anywhere Camera
Cons: Cons: Uses proprietary battery & memory card if you want unlimited video (annoying but minor), no optical viewfinder for those rare times the LCD display washes out, battery drains quickly when transferring pics to computer (I suggest the optional DC power supply & adapter, adapter should be part of the basic camera kit but isn't).
Pros: Pros: Small, rugged, waterproof, easy to use for most simple point&shoot shots, good pics (not as good as my DSLR shots but then it goes where the DSLR can't) & good videos w/sound.
Comments:
I did a lot of research looking for a replacement for my aging Pentax 43WR. I wanted rugged, waterproof, compact & capable of unlimited 640x480x30fps video with sound as we go rafting, to the water park, etc and movie clips of good times are a must with us. The earlier Olympus SW series didn't meet all my requirements but the new 1030SW looked very promising, especially with the firmware update that allows for unlimited video when using the Olympus M+ xD memory card. 
Bottom line: If your emphasis is on rugged/waterproof & small enough to take anywhere then seriously consider this camera. Pics aren't DSLR quality but then it's not made to compete w/DSLR's and the handiness, ruggedness & video capabilities more than make up for pic quality for my needs. If it had an optical viewfinder I'd give it a 5 in spite of the proprietary battery, adapter & memory card.
